required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison Between Rigid Functional And Elastic Bandage For Stabilizing Ankle Support During The Member Of The Chute Football
clinical_study.official_title: COMPARISON BETWEEN RIGID FUNCTIONAL AND ELASTIC BANDAGE FOR STABILIZING ANKLE SUPPORT DURING THE MEMBER OF THE CHUTE FOOTBALL

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the influence of different types of ankle taping in dynamic equilibrium and the electrical activity of the support member during the sporting gesture kicking muscles.

primary_outcome.measure: muscle electrical activity of the support member
primary_outcome.time_frame: individuals will be monitored during the task execution (9 kicks with each member), which gives an average of 3 hours.
primary_outcome.description: Muscle electrical activity of a member of support will be measured only during the time of the kicks, by surface electromyography (EMG), assessing rather the effect of intervention chosen at the time of the shooting sports gesture.

secondary_outcome.measure: dynamic equilibrium of the support limb in standing position
secondary_outcome.time_frame: individuals will be monitored during the task execution (9 kicks with each member), which gives an average of 3 hours.
secondary_outcome.description: The dynamic equilibrium of lower limb support will be measured only during the runtime of the chutes, through the force platform, assessing rather the effect of intervention chosen in the balance of the participant at the time of the shooting sports gesture.

other_outcome.measure: Number of hits on target shooting
other_outcome.description: The number of hits the target will be recorded during the activity execution (9 kicks).

arm_group.description: The volunteers who make up this group, held 18 kicks, 9 with the dominant leg and 9 with the non-dominant lower limb, without the intervention of any kind of bandage.

Volunteers carry out the same protocol described above, however, using rigid bandage. The bandage will be used for tape, Cremer brand and will be applied ankle support member of the individual, in order to limit the movement of the joint inversion.

The protocol will be maintained, however, a brand elastic bandage Kinesio Sport applied to the lower support member of the individual, also in order to limit the movement of the joint inversion is used.

facility.name: Rehabilitation Engineering Laboratory of Sensory Motor
